FILE: cm211710v11.0.txt
DYAD: BELGIUM - CHINA
RIVALRY: RIV520
DISPUTE(S): MID51 

PS-NOTES:

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20170809
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20170809

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

MID51 

TERRMID: MID51 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID51 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID51 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID51 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID51 from cm002710v11.0 narrative, this MID is the Korean War. UN forces, including Belgium, fought along with the South Koreans, and China fought along with the North Koreans. North and South Korea were engaged in a territorial dispute in the Korean War, and China's and UN's opposing support led them to fight directly, triggering this MID between them. Coded third party link to territorial MID because the territorial dispute in Korea led these countries to be involved in this MID. 

MARITMID: MID51 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID51 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID51 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID51 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID51 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID51 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID51 the Korean War had a civil war element, since the war was fought between Nationalists and Communist armies in Korea, each claiming to be the sole government of Korea,but this is coded not civil war because the civil conflict is completely outside of this dyad.

CIVWARLINK: MID51 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID51 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID51 is multilateral and involves civil war in Korea, outside of this dyad. North and South Korea were fighting along communist vs nationalist lines in the Korean War, and each claimed to be the sole government of Korea.

COUPMID: MID51 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID51 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID51 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID51 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

RIVNOTES:
